alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 9:40AM CST until March 17 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River and Wildcat Creek. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to the one to over two and a half inches of rain received from Saturday night through this morning. Minor flooding is expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, MARCH 17... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Thursday, March 17. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Extensive flooding is in progress. Higher rural roads begin to flood. High water isolates many river cabins. Seep water becomes a problem. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Tuesday /10:00 AM EST Tuesday/ the stage was 18.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Tuesday /10:00 AM EST Tuesday/ was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.9 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, March 17. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1045 PM EST /945 PM CST/.
